issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I am unable to see any of my tags from the User Console. I checked the Images and Instances pages specifically.
fields.summary: Tags not being shown for any resources

comments.body: Tags created int eh console seem to display fine, tags created via CLI or other tool are not displaying.

I need help with this one. I haven't yet been able to create tags any other way, so can't test this. Can someone with the means to do so add some tags to the image "emi-8FC93676" on the .36 machine?. I have given it a name tag of "Do Not Delete".

[~jpommer]

Which account are you using? Tags are scoped per account.
I've added some instance tags via EucaLobo, and can see them in the console. Can't reproduce as described.

Still seeing this. Euca2ools output below and screenshot attached.

{code}

[~viglesias] - Could this be a local problem? Can you reproduce on other setups? Is it happening during automated tests? It still works for me every time.
[~jpommer] What do you mean "local problem"? How can I provide more debug info?

Discovered in IRC conversation and experiments that this condition exists only on Vic's machine (so far, investigation ongoing). Its proxy is returning an empty result set for the DescribeTags call. Other setups available at this time do not exhibit the behavior.

[~viglesias], are we satisfied that this is a local problem and not something that a) need be fixed in the UI because it isn't a UI problem (it's in the proxy), and; b) cannot be reproduced reliably anywhere else?

[~jpommer],

Last I knew [~dkavanagh] was trying to debug on my system but not sure how far he got. I can give access to whoever needs it. 

a) What do you mean by local problem?
b) Whether the bug lives in the proxy or the UI is completely irrelevant to me. The User Console relies on both and the bug is against the functionality of the User Console.

This was caused by the CLC emitting XML with the euca: namespace tag. Sjones reported that namespace is a fallback condition in some situation. I'll go see if I can find that information. So, either the CLC you were running had a problem, or some input it got from the proxy caused it to use the fallback namespace. Need to figure out what did it.

Here is what sjones said "that's currently the fallback binding format when the desired binding fails for some reason
you will see something related in the error log"
[~viglesias], can you trigger the problem and look in the CLC logs? We haven't seen this on any system besides yours.
Dropping this off with you, David.
we never patched this, but we also don't have a system to reproduce this other than Vic's home machine AFAIK.
[~viglesias] Can you help determine what should be done with this bug? I have no idea.

[~jloza],

[~dkavanagh] was working on my system at home but not sure how far he got. [~dkavanagh] what was the result of your investigation? How can we move forward?

I got into other stuff and haven't gotten back to your machine. I'm currently evaluating the system you set up with high cpu load. That's seems higher priority since this bug only showed up 1 place so far (that I know of). Ultimately, I need to talk with Steve to better understand what causes this CLC response. It's the CLC response that affects the proxy.

[~dkavanagh],

That priority order seems correct to me.
so [~dkavanagh] this should be assigned to you and not to Jerry. Reassigning to you.
Not reproducible on other setups. Lowering priority.
[~dkavanagh] looks like this wasnt fixed by [~sjones] fix. Do we know what can change the API version boto is using? Assuming thats the core of the issue.

I don't rely on boto's API versions. I explicitly set those in the proxy code so that they work with Eucalyptus. I'll need to look at the CLC logs when the error happens and see if there is something we can determine as the trigger for the namespace fallback. Then, we might be able to determine corrective action.
Vic, do you still see this on your home machine? Have you seen this anywhere else? I need to either get to the bottom of this, or take it off the 3.4 list.
[~dkavanagh], still seeing this unfortunately, not sure what the issue is here.
